articles.title: Secy. Kim Jong Il visits school, unit
articles.content:
Secy. Kim Jong Il visits school, unit
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) - Secretary Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), visited Kim Jong Suk Naval University and KPA Naval Unit No. 597 on Thursday to congratulate the teachers, cadets and sailors on the day of the navy.
   He first went to Kim Jong Suk Naval University.
   He inspected well-appointed rooms for comprehensive training.
   He said that in order to train the cadets into competent naval officers, the school should improve the content of education steadily to meet the demands of the situation.
   The navy is of particular importance to Korea not only today but in the future as the country is bounded by seas on the three sides, he said, advancing important tasks to strengthen the naval force. He then visited KPA Naval Unit No. 597.
   He saw a military training of sailors and gave the unit important tasks to increase its fighting efficiency in every way.
   He then looked round the Unit's Defence Theatre and the sea and called on the sailors to reliably defend the seas of the country.
   He was accompanied by KPA vice marshals Jo Myong Rok and Kim Yong Chun, KPA generals Hyon Chol Hae and Pak Jae Gyong and secretaries of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam and Kim Yong Sun.

articles.title: Secy. Kim Jong Il visits naval school, unit
articles.content:
Secy. Kim Jong Il visits naval school, unit
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) - Secretary Kim Jong Il, Chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), visited Kim Jong Suk Naval University and KPA Naval Unit No. 597 on Thursday to congratulate the teachers, cadets and sailors on the day of the navy.
   He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Jo Myong Rok, Director of the KPA General Political Department= KPA Vice Marshal Kim Yong Chun, Chief of the KPA General staff= and KPA generals Hyon Chol Hae and Pak Jae Gyong.
   The visiting group included secretaries of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam and Kim Yong Sun and First Vice Department Director of the WPK Central Committee Jang Song Thaek.
   Secretary Kim Jong Il arrived at Kim Jong Suk Naval University.
   He was met by KPA Vice Admiral Kim Yun Sim and other officers and senior officials of the university.
   He looked round a monument to President Kim Il Sung's on-the-spot guidance, a monument to his on-the- spot instructions and buildings associated with his feats.
   He recalled the fifty years of the school and said the President's immortal feats for the building of the navy will shine long in the history of the nation.
   He also inspected well-appointed rooms for comprehensive training and learned that the rooms were serving for good military education in modern warfare.
   He said that in order to train the cadets into competent naval officers equipped with modern military knowledge and strong physique, the school should improve the content of education steadily to meet the demands of the situation.
   The navy is of particular importance to Korea not only today but in the future as the country is bounded by seas on the three sides, he said, advancing important tasks to strengthen the naval force.
   He then went to a bedroom, a dining hall, a barber's shop and other logistic facilities of the school. He called for consolidating the supply service bases, improving the management of the school and successfully training the valuable cadets to be the hardcore and pillar of the naval force.
   He inspected an exhibition of educational achievements built on the 50th anniversary of the school.
   He gave the school a machine gun, an automatic rifle and a pair of binoculars as gifts. He had a picture taken with teachers of the school.
   Secretary Kim Jong Il visited KPA Naval Unit No. 597.
   He looked round a monument to the President's on-the-spot guidance, military facilities and combat technical equipment of the unit. 
   He dropped in at a training room of the unit to see a military training of sailors.
   He gave the unit important tasks to increase its fighting efficiency in every way.
   He then looked round the Unit's Defence Theatre and the sea from an observation stand of the military port.
   He called on the sailors to reliably defend the seas of the country.
   He gave the unit's sailors a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle as gifts and had a picture taken with them.

articles.title: Cuban poet lauds Secy. Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Cuban poet lauds Secy. Kim Jong Il
  Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- A Cuban poet, Carmelo Garcia Fernandez, wrote a poem praising Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   The poem titled "To the respected general Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander" says the party, army and people of Korea have become a large force united in one mind, capable of defeating any formidable enemy, under his leadership and the people feel very proud of being guided by the great man.
   Eulogizing him as star bright above both the north and the south of Korea and as sun inspiring humankind with a broad future, the poem notes that the people are shaping their destiny with dignity under his guidance.
   It also says the people are advancing forward, faithful to his ideas and leadership, and will pull down the barrier of national division and achieve the reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Press conference at Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Press conference at Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA)-- Cuban Ambassador to Korea Jose Ramon Rodriguez Varona called a press conference at his Embassy on Thursday as regards the amendment to the law on foreign policy reform, which was adopted at the U.S. House Foreign Affairs Committee on May 6.
   The Ambassador told reporters that the adopted ten-point amendment is aimed at tightening blockade against Cuba and intensifying sabotages within the country.
   He said the adoption of the bill is part of the U.S. anti- Cuban plan and a violation of other countries' sovereignty. 
It is inviting a strong protest from among the world's people, he added.
   Then, he gave answers to questions put by reporters.

articles.title: Letter to world youth and student organizations
articles.content:
Letter to world youth and student organizations
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Korean Student Committee sent a letter to world youth and student organizations on Thursday as regards the fact that the south Korean authorities have been cracking down upon students' democratic activities at the point of the bayonet.
   The south Korean authorities mobilized over 20,000 policemen to block the fifth-term ceremony of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon), an umbrella body of one million students, the letter said, and added:
   At the ceremony, "Hanchongryon" plans to decide on its participation in the 14th World Festival of Youth and Students to be held in Cuba from late July to early August. 
The authorities claim that the participation in the festival, a "gathering of students from communist states", will be regarded as an "act of benefitting the enemy."
   This shows that they are ignorant of the festival in which youth and students from five continents participate in the idea of peace and friendship, transcending difference in ideology and system, religious belief and race.
   It is a natural right of "Hanchongryon" as a legitimate student organisation to participate in the 14th festival to meet with their north Korean and foreign counterparts and deepen friendship as they did during the 13th festival in Pyongyang. This can never be criminalized.
   The south Korean authorities walked away some 600 students affiliated with "Hanchongryon" trying to hold the new-term ceremony and threatened that all those involved in protests will be "sternly punished".
   However, the justice-minded students under "Hanchongryon" held the ceremony on the early morning of Thursday and are vigorously fighting against the authorities' fascist repression.
   The Korean Student Committee expresses thanks to the world bodies for their support to and solidarity with the Korean students and people in the efforts for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country. 
   It also expresses the expectation that the organizations will pay attention to the grave situation prevailing in south Korea, take steps to check the south Korean authorities' repression of campus movement and extend positive support and solidarity to "Hanchongryon's" just struggle.

articles.title: Wreaths laid before Statue of Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Wreaths laid before Statue of Kim Hyong Jik 
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Party and Government officials, working people and servicemen laid wreaths before a Statue of Kim Hyong Jik, who was an indomitable revolutionary fighter and an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese National Liberation Movement in Korea, in Ponghwa- Ri and his tomb in Mangyongdae on Thursday, the 71st anniversary of his death.
   Seen there were wreaths sent by Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   Among the officials were Ri Jong Ok and Pak Song Chol.
   Amid the wreath-laying music, wreaths were laid in the name of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, the DPRK Central People's Committee, the Administration Council, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, etc. 
   Wreaths were also laid before his statues in Chongsu, Sakju county, revolutionary site and Junggang-up.

articles.title: Japan criticised for her impudent act
articles.content:
Japan criticised for her impudent act 
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Japan, considering that it is a matter of time to get a permanent seat of the UN Security Council, demands that a new permanent member state of the UNSC should have veto power.
   Rodong Sinmun today, commenting on this, describes her claim as arrogant and shameless.
   The news analyst goes on:
   The issue of electing more permanent member states of the UNSC cannot be solved without the support from developing countries. Developing countries keep Japan at arm's length.
   The Japanese reactionaries with the vaulting ambition for getting a permanent seat of the UNSC are concerned about the attitude of developing countries. That is why they are trying to curry favor with those countries at any cost.
   It requires little penetration to guess that Japan would look down upon other countries and stoop to any extraterritorial act, if she became a permanent member state of the UNSC.
   If Japan got a permanent seat of the UNSC and became a political power, it would increase the danger of militarist aggression and lead to a terrible holocaust on humankind as in the past.
   Japan has a lot of things to do before wanting to get a permanent seat of the UNSC. Her top priority at present is to atone for the past crimes. Without the liquidation of the past Japan can neither enjoy trust from the world people nor get a permanent seat of the UNSC.

articles.title: Press review
articles.content:
Press review 
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Papers here today report that Secretary Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), visited Kim Jong Suk Naval University and KPA Naval Unit No. 597 to congratulate the teachers, cadets and sailors on the day of the navy.
   Rodong Sinmun edits a picture of Secretary Kim Jong Il looking round a monument to President Kim Il Sung's on-the-spot guidance in the university and pictures he had taken with teachers of the school and sailors.
   Printed in the paper is an editorial titled "Children's Union members should always be ready for the sake of the respected general Kim Jong Il" on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the founding of the Korean Children's Union (June 6, 1946).
   Minju Joson runs an article titled "Our leader and children" with a Korean painting portraying President Kim Il Sung among children.
   Papers give an account of a national meeting and flower exhibition of schoolchildren to mark the anniversary of the KCU.
   Senior party and government officials, working people and soldiers of the people's army laid wreaths before the statues and the tomb of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, on the occasion of the 71st anniversary of his death, the press says.
   Rodong Sinmun carries an article entitled "Faith of Juche is conscience of time."
   Papers carry a letter issued by the committee for the peaceful reunification of the fatherland, demanding the resignation of Kim Young Sam, and a declaration published at the 5th-term inaugural ceremony of the South Korean federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) on the struggle of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification in 1997.
   Papers inform the readers of a grave military provocation committed by battle ships of the south Korean puppet army deep in the north's territorial waters on the West sea of Korea on June 5.
   Papers convey news that over 2,000 students held the 5th- term inaugural ceremony of "Hanchongryon" at Seoul National University. 
   The Korean Student Committee sent a letter to the world youth and student bodies as regards the attempts of the south Korean authorities to check democratic activities of students, says the press.
   Papers carry commentaries denouncing the puppet clique's crackdown on "Hanchongryon".
   Conspicuous in Rodong Sinmun is an article blasting the corrupt policy and irregularities of Kim Young Sam.
  A commentary of the paper criticises Japan for her impudent act to get a permanent seat of the Security Council of the United Nations.
   The paper runs an article on the criminal acts of the renegades of socialism to destroy the economic foundation of socialist ideology.
   Minju Joson observes the National Day of Sweden.

articles.title: Mongolians, Mexicans to commemorate President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Mongolians, Mexicans to commemorate President Kim Il Sung 
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Committees for commemorating President Kim Il Sung were formed in Mongolia and Mexico.
   At the inaugural meeting of the Mongolian Committee held on May 30, Chairman Ch. Surenjav and Vice-Chairman J. Tsevelmaa of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Association were elected its Chairman and Vice-Chairman respectively.
   It was decided at the meeting to hold a memorial service, retrospective meeting, seminar and other events during the days of commemoration in the capital and local areas.
   Addressing the meeting, the chairman said it was their duty and obligation to pay the highest tribute to President Kim Il Sung, the best friend of the Mongolian people.
   The inaugural meeting of the Mexican Committee took place on May 27.
   Its chairman is Hector Manuel Cuellar, President of the Mexican Fellowship Union to honor the memory of President Kim Il Sung, and its secretaries are Alejandro Rosales Sanchez, Secretary of the Mexican Committee for Supporting the Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and Andres Gasca Sanchez, Organizational Secretary of the Afore-Said fellowship union.
   Discussed at the meeting was an action programme for letting Mexican people know about the brilliant life and revolutionary feats of President Kim Il Sung with the approach of the third anniversary of his death. 
   A letter to Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: CPRF demands resignation of Kim Young Sam
articles.content:
CPRF demands resignation of Kim Young Sam
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland (CPRF) issued a letter on June 5 over the fact that the grave political confrontation is being aggravated day by day owing to the shameless acts of Kim Young Sam, "President" of south Korea.
   The letter said: 
   Kim Young Sam spent 2,000 billion won or scores of times more than the legally limited amount at the "Presidential Election" of 1992, but he refused to clarify the "Election" fund, laying the blame at the door of the "political camp," "wrong political practices" and "Election system" of south Korea.
   Kim Young Sam fabricated his "Election as President" by squandering the taxes collected from workers, peasants and other people and made a fortune by abusing power. Far from making an apology, he even threatened the people with an "important decision". For this alone, he deserves punishment.
   The south Korean people strongly call for the immediate resignation of Kim Young Sam. They are determined to make him pay dearly for his crimes.
   Kim Young Sam must immediately step down, as demanded by all parties, all groups and people from all walks of life in south Korea.
   If Kim Young Sam refuses to resign, he will be overthrown.

articles.title: Kim Young Sam group hit for harsher suppression
articles.content:
Kim Young Sam group hit for harsher suppression
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today in a signed commentary denounces the Kim Young Sam group for intensifying the suppression of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon).
   The analyst further says:
   On June 3 the fascist clique gave the prosecution throughout south Korea instructions to immediately arrest the leading officials of "Hanchongryon" who manipulated a demonstration for the inaugural meeting of the fifth-term "Hanchongryon."
   Still worse, they claim that the leadership of the "Hanchongryon" is "pro-north forces" following the "north's strategy of making revolution in south Korea".
   Their smear campaign is intended to prevent their own destruction.
   With any smear campaign the Kim Young Sam fascist clique cannot justify their brutal suppression nor conceal their criminal design.
   Kim Young Sam is now making desperate efforts to get rid of the most serious ruling crisis caused by the Hanbo loan scandal and the controversial "Presidential Election" funds, but in vain. An increasing number of the people are calling for his "early resignation" and "immediate overthrow".
   The harsher suppression of students and people will only precipitate the Kim Young Sam fascist clique's destruction.

articles.title: Military provocation on west sea
articles.content:
Military provocation on West sea
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Three warships of the south Korean puppets intruded deep into the territorial waters of the DPRK on the West sea on Thursday and fired shells at some ten peaceful fishing boats.
   The warships infiltrated from Taeyonphyong island into the waters south of Ssanggyo-Ri, Kangryong county, South Hwanghae Province, and surrounded the fishing boats in a bid to kidnap them.
   When a naval patrol ship of the Korean People's Army appeared on the scene, the enemy ships fired shells at the fishing boats before fleeing south.
   This brutal military provocation did not develop into an armed conflict entirely because of the patience and self- control of the KPA soldiers.

articles.title: Papers on anniversary of Korean Children's Union
articles.content:
Papers on anniversary of Korean Children's Union
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Papers here today observe the 51st anniversary of the Korean Children's Union.
   Rodong Sinmun carries an editorial calling on the members of the Korean Children's Union to be always prepared for the sake of Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   The paper says:
   Members of the union are creditably growing to be young revolutionaries boundlessly loyal to Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   The Korean children's movement, founded and guided by Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, has reached a new higher stage under the wise leadership of Secretary Kim Jong Il, who shows benevolent care for the KCU members. 
   The union has made big progress and its members reliably grown up thanks to Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
   The KCU members trust and follow only Generalissimo Kim Il Sung and Secretary Kim Jong Il with absolute loyalty like sunflowers. 
   The general task of the Korean Children's Movement is to strengthen the Korean Children Union as the revolutionary children's organisation true to Generalissimo Kim Il Sung forever, as wished by Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   The KCU members should prepare themselves to be children's guards unfailingly faithful to Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
   They should remain loyal to the general everytime and everywhere, under the slogan "Let us be always ready for the sake of the respected general Kim Jong Il !".
   In an article titled "Our leader and children", Minju Joson deals with legendary stories about the Generalissimo's love for the rising generation whom he called "Kings of the Country".

articles.title: Camping of children in full swing
articles.content:
Camping of children in full swing
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren enjoy camping at children's camps throughout the DPRK.
   On the occasion of the formation day of the Korean Children's Union (June 6), hundreds of children from all over the country are enjoying at the Mangyongdae Children's Camp located at the foot of Mt. Ryongak in Pyongyang.
   The time of their camping is seven days.
   During the camping they consolidate what they learned at school and make various activities such as mountaineering, sports and games to build up their bodies and minds.
   At the Myohyangsan Children's Mountaineering Camp many children are spending a pleasant time climbing scenic spots of Mt. Myohyang including Sangwon hermitage and Manphokdong and making various activities.
   During the camp they make samples of insects and plants, scale cliffs and cook their meals. They also have an art contest, a popular dance, sports and games. 
   The period of camping for schoolchildren is from April 1 to the end of November every year in Korea.
   There are some camps which open all the year round. 
   The time of camping is 12 days, 9 days, 7 days or 3 days.

articles.title: Unforgettable story of Mirim field
articles.content:
Unforgettable story of Mirim field 
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- It is 50 years since President Kim Il Sung helped the peasants with rice transplanting on Mirim field right after Korea's liberation from the Japanese imperialist colonial rule.
   On June 7, 1947, the President went to the Mirim field.   
   He shook hands with cheering peasants and stepped into the paddy field, urging them to transplant rice seedlings together with him.
   When an official offered a pair of boots to him, the President asked him if he had ever seen the peasants transplanting rice seedlings in boots. He went on to say that it is convenient to transplant rice seedlings with bare feet.
   When village women prepared some food, the President offered it first to old men. And he acquainted himself with the farming and livelihood of the villagers and told them about an ambitious plan of new rural construction in liberated Korea.
    At sunset an official repeatedly informed him that it was time for him to be off for a function. The President then shook hands with the peasants before leaving the paddy field.
    The tender image of the President is still vivid in the minds of peasants and other people despite the passage of half a century.
    The yearning of all the koreans for the President, who always found himself among the people, is growing stronger with the approach of his third death anniversary. They are determined to bring about bumper crops this year, come what May.

articles.title: Declaration on struggle of Pomchonghakryon in 1997
articles.content:
Declaration on struggle of Pomchonghakryon in 1997
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- A declaration was published at the 5th-term inaugural ceremony of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) held on June 5 on the struggle of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification (Pomchonghakryon) in 1997.
   The declaration was made public on behalf of students in the south, the north and abroad.
   Under the banner of national independence and peace, Pomchonghakryon will actively fight to foil the moves of the US. imperialists and the Kim Young Sam group to unleash a war on the Korean Peninsula and keep the division of the Korean nation, the declaration says, and goes on:
   In order to establish a system for lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula, Pomchonghakryon will make all efforts to realise a peace agreement between the DPRK and the United States, withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea and complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, to frustrate harsh suppression of pro-reunification personages, to abolish the "National Security Law," to achieve great national unity and to further confirm the confederacy formula as the nation's common way of reunification.
   Meetings will be held in the south, the north and abroad this year marking the 25th anniversary of the publication of the July 4 north-south joint statement, and a joint appeal be adopted there to call on the 70 million Koreans to realise pan-national dialogue for national independence and peace.   
   Pomchonghakryon plans to jointly participate in the 14th World Festival of Youth and Students to be held in Havana, strengthen international solidarity with the forces advocating anti-imperialism, independence and peace, and intensify the joint struggle of youth and students in the south, the north and abroad.
   The 7th grand festival for reunification of Pomchonghakryon will be held in Seoul between August 13 and 15.
   Pomchonghakryon will take the lead in the struggle for all Koreans and reunification organisations in the south, north and overseas to jointly celebrate August 15 on the basis of the three principles and trinity with stress laid on strengthening of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification and successful holding of the 8th pan-national rally this year.
   A struggle for visiting the Mausoleum of King Tangun on October 3 will be waged to enhance the spirit of great national unity among youth and students and harden their resolve for a new vigorous struggle.

articles.title: Gift to Secy. Kim Jong Il from Malaysian party
articles.content:
Gift to Secy. Kim Jong Il from Malaysian party
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) - Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Central Committee of the Malaysian People's Movement.
   The gift was handed to Secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Choe Thae Bok, who is also alternate member of the political bureau of the WPK Central Committee, by Secretary General of the Movement Central Committee Tan Sri Datuk Chan Choong Tak, on a visit to Korea.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK, Russian parliament delegations
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK, Russian parliament delegations 
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between delegations of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) and the Russian State Duma at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
   Both sides at the talks discussed development of the friendly relations between the parliaments and peoples of the two countries and a series of matters of common concern. 
   Present at the talks were Ri Tong Chol, member of the SPA Foreign Affairs Committee and Chairman of the Korea-Russia Friendship Parliamentary Group, Korean officials concerned and members of the Russian delegation led by Mikhail Monastirski, Chairman of the Southeast Asia and Asia-Pacific Area Sub-Committee of the Geopolitical Affairs Committee of the State Duma.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry spokesman on Ikeda's remarks
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry spokesman on Ikeda's remarks
Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea issued the following statement today:
   It has been reported that Japanese Foreign Minister Ikeda at a recent meeting of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the House of Representatives urged the DPRK to dispose of its resources properly, strive for stable life of people and reduce armaments in order to solve the food problem. He even slandered the policy of the DPRK leadership, saying what the "Administrator" should do and how.
   If it is true, we cannot but regard his remarks as an intolerable challenge to the Korean people.
   The biggest problem is that he took a very rude attitude towards the leadership of the DPRK.
   As is known to the world, Secretary Kim Jong Il, busy as he is leading all affairs of the party, the state and the army, always pays deep attention to the people's living conditions and stands in the forefront to overcome the current difficulties.
   That is why the Korean people regard him as their father and the sun of the nation and are determined to share weal and woe with him.
   If anyone hurls mud at the headquarters of our revolution, we will never pardon him, whoever he may be.
   Ikeda's remarks revealed an unreasonable intention to interfere in the DPRK's internal affairs. He slandered the DPRK's policies, contending that it should solve the food shortage in such a way as "arms reduction".
   Where and how we direct our resources and manpower is a matter pertaining to our sovereignty.
   Obviously, it is vital to our existence that we, subjected to persistent military threat by the imperialists and reactionaries, attach importance to the military and further develop our revolutionary armed forces to be invincible.
   If Japan is truly concerned about our food shortage, it should clearly see the situation, instead of crying for "arms reduction".
   Our army and people will as ever firmly defend our socialist system, a valuable gain of our revolution.
   Especially, our people will devotedly defend the headquarters of the revolution headed by Secretary Kim Jong Il and annihilate those who provoke us even a little bit, wherever they may be.
